The Elliott Wave Theory charting technique supports a bullish wave lasting 2-3 months, starting late November and ending sometime around February or March. All the different charting systems and indicators, fractals and wave projections, point to February as being a major date, possibly the time when a market phase reaches its end. Elliott agrees.

Here we have a classic 1,2,3,4,5 Up-wave pattern, a bullish impulse. We have a perfect alternation between the first correction, wave 2, and the second correction, wave 4. The former being short and the latter being long. Perfect.

Then we know the last wave, the fifth wave is the speculative wave. This is where the market turns euphoric or erratic, parabolic action. In this wave Ethereum can easily produce a major advanceâ€”the stage is already set.

Then comes the final target, the resistance zone. Elliott Wave could call for an end target of around $10,500 for the fifth and final wave of the present bullish impulse. If you look at the chart, you can see that $10,500 sits perfectly between 2.618 ($8,500) and 3.618 ($11,200) Fib. extension levels.

It isn't over. Ethereum is going up.

What is really means when you hear that Bitcoin options are expiring.

Bitcoin options expiring actually means that a group of price bet/stakes on Bitcoin is ending on a particular day. 

People normally use options to predict if        $BTC,    $ETH , e.t.c would go up or down a certain price within a particular timeframe/date. When the date arrives:

-If the prediction was right, it pays out.

-If wrong, it becomes worthless and the contract closes up and disappears.

(Options are financial contracts that gives an individual the right to   trade i.e; buy or sell a particular asset at a set price, within a time period.) 

Prices of the specific asset usually gets volatile around expiriy option days because traders often buy or sell right before the expiry date to adjust their positions.
